title: Mourning the death of David F. Crowley, distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  mourning the death of David F. Crowley, distin-
guished citizen and devoted member of his community

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  to  pay  tribute  to
citizens  of  the  State  of  New York whose lifework and civic endeavor
served to enhance the quality of life in their communities and the great
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, David F. Crowley of Binghamton, New York, died on  Wednesday,
November 10, 2010, at the age of 73; and
  WHEREAS,  A  graduate  of  Binghamton  High School, Boston College and
Syracuse Law School, David F. Crowley began his legal career working  in
Albany,  New York, as Assistant Counsel to Senate Minority Leader George
Ingalls; and
  WHEREAS, David F. Crowley distinguished himself in his profession  and
by his sincere dedication and substantial contribution to the welfare of
his community; and
  WHEREAS,  He continued in his private practice at Shaw, O'Brien, Crow-
ley and Reynolds for more than 45 years; and
  WHEREAS, In 2004, he was appointed City Court Judge;  he  was  also  a
member  of both the New York State Bar Association and the Broome County
Bar Association; and
  WHEREAS, David F. Crowley's commitment to excellence, and  his  spirit
of humanity, carried over into all fields of enterprise, including char-
itable and civic endeavors; and
  WHEREAS,  He served as General Counsel for American Pipe and Plastics,
Inc. and interim CEO, and was a member of the Binghamton Boys and  Girls
Club; and
  WHEREAS,  David  F.  Crowley loved playing tennis, driving his 1951 MG
and spending time with his family and friends; his two  favorite  places
were Oguaga Lake and Freeport Bahamas; and
  WHEREAS,  Predeceased  by  his father and co-founder of Crowley Foods,
Frank L. Crowley and his mother, Mary V. Crowley,  his  brothers,  Homer
Crowley, Brian Crowley and stepbrother, Eugene Crowley, David F. Crowley
is  survived by his loving wife of over 50 years, Joan M. Crowley; three
children, daughter, Dr.  Brooke  Crowley-Esposito  and  son-in-law,  Dr.
Albert  Esposito; two grandchildren, Colby Esposito and Cleary Esposito;
son, Kiernan M. Crowley, Esq. and daughter-in-law, Meghan Young Crowley;
four grandchildren, Conlon Crowley, Ronan  Crowley,  Brody  Crowley  and
Alley Crowley; daughter, Kendall Crowley-Quackenbos and son-in-law, John
Quackenbos; and two grandchildren, Layk Quackenbos and Boden Quackenbos;
as well as a stepbrother, Dr. Leonard Crowley; and
  WHEREAS,  Armed  with  a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with a sense of
compassion, and comforted by a loving family, David  F.  Crowley  leaves
behind  a  legacy  which  will  long endure the passage of time and will
remain as a comforting memory to all  he  served  and  befriended;  now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
mourn the death of David F. Crowley, distinguished citizen  and  devoted
member of his community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of David F. Crowley.
